intro: Tibouchina oerstedii, commonly known as the purple false heather, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its vibrant purple to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Tibouchina oerstedii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
